boardgame.name: Fauna
Фауна
ファウナ
boardgame.description: 360 animals on big cards are waiting for the players of Fauna. Every round a single animal presents itself by name and picture. The 2-6 players try to guess the animal's weight, length, height, tail length and - most important - the areas in which the animal lives on the Earth. The early bird gets the worm: an area on the big map or a sector on the scales already occupied by a player token cannot be chosen a second time. When no player wants to set another token the round ends and the scoring is performed. Tokens on correct spaces get points for the corresponding player, also tokens in the direct neighborhood of correct spaces score points. Tokens not earning points are temporarily out of the game - so risk should be carefully considered. Next round - next animal - starting player changes. The first player who reaches a certain total score wins (normally after 8-12 animals)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

FoxMind (FOX 310710) Do you know where the panda lives? Do you know where the babirusa lives? Do you know what a babirusa is? In the game Fauna, you are not expected to know all the answers, simply gather your wits and make an educated guess. You are right on target? Great! You are close? That_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s good too, since you score partial points. The more you play the better you get. Playing Fauna involves some fun betting for points, but don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t get cocky, as this may cost you your hide.

Rated Good due primarily to condition of box. Box is lightly beaten up (whitening, scuffing) on most of the sides and corners. On two of the corners of the box top, the box art is split but the structure of the box does not seem particularly weakened. None of this wear affected the contents inside as the plastic insert and play pieces appear mostly like-new still. Play pieces (cards, card holder, lion token and betting markers) are in perfect condition.
The board on both sides has damage to the artwork from the panel folding around the South Indian Ocean (shown in picture). The damage is more noticeable on the Metric side but amounts to about the same condition as shown on the Imperial side.
